description: Returns the definition of a specific DataBrew dataset.

parameters.name: Name
parameters.description: The name of the dataset to be described.

nested_items.name: CreatedBy
nested_items.description: The identifier (user name) of the user who created the dataset.

nested_items.name: CreateDate
nested_items.description: The date and time that the dataset was created.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the dataset.

nested_items.name: Format
nested_items.description: The file format of a dataset that is created from an Amazon S3 file or folder.

nested_items.name: FormatOptions
nested_items.description: Represents a set of options that define the structure of either comma-separated value (CSV), Excel, or JSON input.

nested_items.name: MultiLine
nested_items.description: A value that specifies whether JSON input contains embedded new line characters.

nested_items.name: SheetNames
nested_items.description: One or more named sheets in the Excel file that will be included in the dataset.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: SheetIndexes
nested_items.description: One or more sheet numbers in the Excel file that will be included in the dataset.
(integer) ---

nested_items.name: HeaderRow
nested_items.description: A variable that specifies whether the first row in the file is parsed as the header. If this value is false, column names are auto-generated.

nested_items.name: Delimiter
nested_items.description: A single character that specifies the delimiter being used in the CSV file.

nested_items.name: HeaderRow
nested_items.description: A variable that specifies whether the first row in the file is parsed as the header. If this value is false, column names are auto-generated.

nested_items.name: S3InputDefinition
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 location where the data is stored.

nested_items.name: Bucket
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 bucket name.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The unique name of the object in the bucket.

nested_items.name: BucketOwner
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID of the bucket owner.

nested_items.name: DataCatalogInputDefinition
nested_items.description: The Glue Data Catalog parameters for the data.

nested_items.name: CatalogId
nested_items.description: The unique identifier of the Amazon Web Services account that holds the Data Catalog that stores the data.

nested_items.name: DatabaseName
nested_items.description: The name of a database in the Data Catalog.

nested_items.name: TableName
nested_items.description: The name of a database table in the Data Catalog. This table corresponds to a DataBrew dataset.

nested_items.name: TempDirectory
nested_items.description: Represents an Amazon location where DataBrew can store intermediate results.

nested_items.name: Bucket
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 bucket name.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The unique name of the object in the bucket.

nested_items.name: BucketOwner
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID of the bucket owner.

nested_items.name: DatabaseInputDefinition
nested_items.description: Connection information for dataset input files stored in a database.

nested_items.name: GlueConnectionName
nested_items.description: The Glue Connection that stores the connection information for the target database.

nested_items.name: DatabaseTableName
nested_items.description: The table within the target database.

nested_items.name: TempDirectory
nested_items.description: Represents an Amazon S3 location (bucket name, bucket owner, and object key) where DataBrew can read input data, or write output from a job.

nested_items.name: Bucket
nested_items.description: The Amazon S3 bucket name.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: The unique name of the object in the bucket.

nested_items.name: BucketOwner
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services account ID of the bucket owner.

nested_items.name: QueryString
nested_items.description: Custom SQL to run against the provided Glue connection. This SQL will be used as the input for DataBrew projects and jobs.

nested_items.name: SourceArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) associated with the dataset. Currently, DataBrew only supports ARNs from Amazon AppFlow.

nested_items.name: LastModifiedDate
nested_items.description: The date and time that the dataset was last modified.

nested_items.name: LastModifiedBy
nested_items.description: The identifier (user name) of the user who last modified the dataset.

nested_items.name: Source
nested_items.description: The location of the data for this dataset, Amazon S3 or the Glue Data Catalog.

nested_items.name: PathOptions
nested_items.description: A set of options that defines how DataBrew interprets an Amazon S3 path of the dataset.

nested_items.name: LastModifiedDateCondition
nested_items.description: If provided, this structure defines a date range for matching Amazon S3 objects based on their LastModifiedDate attribute in Amazon S3.

nested_items.name: Expression
nested_items.description: The expression which includes condition names followed by substitution variables, possibly grouped and combined with other conditions. For example, '(starts_with :prefix1 or starts_with :prefix2) and (ends_with :suffix1 or ends_with :suffix2)'. Substitution variables should start with --:' symbol.

nested_items.name: ValuesMap
nested_items.description: The map of substitution variable names to their values used in this filter expression.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: FilesLimit
nested_items.description: If provided, this structure imposes a limit on a number of files that should be selected.

nested_items.name: MaxFiles
nested_items.description: The number of Amazon S3 files to select.

nested_items.name: OrderedBy
nested_items.description: A criteria to use for Amazon S3 files sorting before their selection. By default uses LAST_MODIFIED_DATE as a sorting criteria. Currently it's the only allowed value.

nested_items.name: Order
nested_items.description: A criteria to use for Amazon S3 files sorting before their selection. By default uses DESCENDING order, i.e. most recent files are selected first. Another possible value is ASCENDING.

nested_items.name: Parameters
nested_items.description: A structure that maps names of parameters used in the Amazon S3 path of a dataset to their definitions.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: (string) ---

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: The name of the parameter that is used in the dataset's Amazon S3 path.

nested_items.name: Type
nested_items.description: The type of the dataset parameter, can be one of a --String', --Number' or --Datetime'.

nested_items.name: DatetimeOptions
nested_items.description: Additional parameter options such as a format and a timezone. Required for datetime parameters.

nested_items.name: Format
nested_items.description: Required option, that defines the datetime format used for a date parameter in the Amazon S3 path. Should use only supported datetime specifiers and separation characters, all literal a-z or A-Z characters should be escaped with single quotes. E.g. 'MM.dd.yyyy---at'-HH:mm'.

nested_items.name: TimezoneOffset
nested_items.description: Optional value for a timezone offset of the datetime parameter value in the Amazon S3 path. Shouldn't be used if Format for this parameter includes timezone fields. If no offset specified, UTC is assumed.

nested_items.name: LocaleCode
nested_items.description: Optional value for a non-US locale code, needed for correct interpretation of some date formats.

nested_items.name: CreateColumn
nested_items.description: Optional boolean value that defines whether the captured value of this parameter should be used to create a new column in a dataset.

nested_items.name: Expression
nested_items.description: The expression which includes condition names followed by substitution variables, possibly grouped and combined with other conditions. For example, '(starts_with :prefix1 or starts_with :prefix2) and (ends_with :suffix1 or ends_with :suffix2)'. Substitution variables should start with --:' symbol.

nested_items.name: ValuesMap
nested_items.description: The map of substitution variable names to their values used in this filter expression.
(string) ---
(string) ---
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: ResourceArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the dataset.
